content: Loogle tells me that we don't have the equality version of docs#Submonoid.closure_mul_le under an assumption of commutativity. I assume this means we're missing the corresponding statements for all subobjects in the algebraic hierarchy then. Is that correct?
Consider addition and S = T = {2}, closure (S + T) = closure {4} < closure {2} = closure S âŠ” closure T.
Probably it's true if you assume the sets contain an identity element?
Ah yes, I was assuming they contain the Identity.
